text: Just listened to <@U02DHRR2L> and <@U416T0AAX> youtube.... I'm willing to write docs... in the past I did it by just rebuilding things over and over attempting the marketing 'demo'... So I'd basically do that for a DR demo of what <@U416T0AAX> was describes.

What I was doing was writing myself docs to do <@U02DGQYK1> VBox demo and then move to <@U02DHRR2L> kubespray demo as I'm under the impression that DRP is really "PXE to Node" - (inventory def) -> "Node to Cluster (or system)"... which I intend to use Ansible (as I think <@U416T0AAX> also intends)

... ANYWAY... workflow wise... you guys are pretty good at showing your working demos... I'm thinking if I just do what I'm doing (which is going through the video and attempting to re-create) then cross link the resources and documents...  what I did in the past was to link resource much like the angular docs but also with video step links (  <https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$document> )

attachments.title: AngularJS
attachments.text: AngularJS is what HTML would have been, had it been designed for building web-apps. Declarative templates with data-binding, MVC, dependency injection and great testability story all implemented with pure client-side JavaScript!

text: <@U54E4SD4G> and other interested parties: <https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision/pull/530> is the start of adding support baking basic repo management into DRP at template rendering time.

attachments.title: WIP Add repo management functions to render data by VictorLowther 路 Pull Request #530 路 digitalrebar/provision
attachments.text: This WIP pull request begins adding direct support in DRP for basic repository management at OS install time as well as at OS run time. It is not ready to be pulled yet, but serves as a reference p...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: WIP Add repo management functions to render data by VictorLowther 路 Pull Request #530 路 digitalrebar/provision

text: If you want better names for the functions that the templates will use to render templates, now is the time to suggest better ones. Preferably as review comments :slightly_smiling_face:
